updating.notes:
* Use Symfony 4; require at least PHP 7.1.14. As this is a breaking change,
  this increases the CLI major version from 3.x to 4.x.
* Integrate platformsh/oauth2 library and platformsh/client version 2.x.
* Cache the DI container.
* Use service autowiring. This allows new services or commands to be created
  without extra service configuration (beyond their constructor arguments).
* Configure command lazy-loading. If using the full command name or alias, this
  saves around 50ms. Using an abbreviation or shortcut bypasses the performance
  benefit as it requires all command classes to be instantiated.
* Lots of other refactoring, including adding static/strict types.
* Remove deprecated command options.

Major changes since version 2.x.x:

* In version 2.x.x, the CLI had a project file structure including a 'repository' directory (and a 'builds' directory, 'shared', etc.). In version 3.x.x, this is no longer the case: the CLI operates directly inside your project's Git repository. The CLI will work with the old file structure, and there is a migration tool ('platform legacy-migrate') for updating to the new structure.

* The web root has changed location from 'www' to '_www', to avoid conflicts with actual project files in the repo.

* The CLI now requires PHP version 5.5.9 (minimum) due to updated dependencies.

Version 3.x.x also comes with many other smaller improvements and bug fixes.
The web root has moved again, from '.www' to '_www'. If you have already been using version 3, you may wish to update your local web server configuration.

* Adds 'db:size' command for a rough estimate of DB disk usage
* Fixes database commands where the relationship name is not 'database'
* Fixes 'sql' command on PostgreSQL databases

See: https://github.com/platformsh/platformsh-cli/releases/v3.8.0

* Adds `environment:push` (`push`) command
* Adds `--identity-file` option to commands using SSH
* Adds `--parent` option to `environment:activate` command

This release adds new options to the db:dump command:
  --gzip (-z) to compress the output
  --table to specify the table(s) to include
  --exclude-table to specify the table(s) to exclude
  --schema-only to include only schemas, not data

And other minor bug fixes. See:
https://github.com/platformsh/platformsh-cli/releases/v3.11.0

* Add `project:set-remote` command
* Clarify self-update messages
* Some minor bug fixes in the `branch`, `checkout`, and `integration:get` commands

* Improve `get` command when the user does not have access to `master` branch
* Allow `web` command to be used with a non-existent environment ID
* Allow `updates.check` to be overridden by an env var, e.g. `PLATFORMSH_CLI_UPDATES_CHECK=0`
* More specific suggested `.gitignore` file for Drupal vanilla projects

* The `build` command now installs build-time dependencies by default (use
  `--no-deps` for the old behavior).
* This release also adds commands to run a local web server (the PHP built-in
  server). But these commands are at a "beta" stability, and they can only be
  enabled via a feature flag, for example:

  # ---- ~/.platformsh/config.yaml ----
  experimental:
      # Enable "platform create" command.
      enable_create: true
      # Enable "platform server:run" and related commands.
      enable_local_server: true

* Added `route:get` command to view a resolved route to an application
* Renamed `environment:routes` command to `route:list` (still under the alias `routes`)
* Improved caching for relationships, routes, and app config
* Fixed integration option names

This release adds `certificate` commands, to list, add, and delete SSL certificates from a project, including new automatically-provisioned Let's Encrypt certificates.

Other changes since v3.14.5:

* Fix an issue using `ssh` command on Windows
* Make detection of the system timezone fallback to the PHP default
* Use pseudo-terminal for SSH where possible (enables colors for some CLI programs)
* Minor improvements to `activity:list`

* Added a `--directory` option to `db:dump`
* Added ability to load more than 10 activities in `activity:list`
* Added `auth:token` and `project:curl` commands (intended for support and debugging)
* Updated `self::install` so it doesn't write Bashisms to `.profile`
* Updated activity descriptions
* Switched to GitBook native search (rather than Google) in `docs` command

* Added new `mount:upload` and `mount:download` commands, which help
  transferring files to and from writable file mounts, and a `mount:list`
  command which shows the available mounts. Thanks to @markushausammann for the
  PR.
* Users may now log in with their username instead of their email address.
* Fixed a bug introduced in v3.20.5, which unintentionally hid output from
  external commands.

* Added automatic generation of YAML-format Drush site aliases for Drupal projects (in addition to the current PHP-format site aliases). Use `platform drush-aliases -r` to recreate aliases.
* Moved site aliases from `~/.drush` to `~/.drush/site-aliases`.
* Fixed the table of environments to stop wrapping environment IDs (it was breaking color formatting).
* Changed wording of 'rebuild' warning, to 'redeploy'.

- A public website URL can now be used in the --project (-p) option
- Added `--exclude` and `--include` options to `mount` commands
- Added `--excluded-environments` option for webhook integrations*
- Added Gitlab integration support*

(* the last two will apply to an upcoming Platform.sh version, 2.7)

* Add repo:cat and repo:ls commands
* Allow default target/source in mount:upload and mount:download when --yes is used
* Add -W alias to --no-wait option in push command
* (from Symfony Console 3.4) Allow case-insensitive command shortcuts
* (from Symfony Console 3.4) Fix combining one-letter options
* Write curl debug output to STDERR, not STDOUT
* Fix some Drush 9.0.0-rc1 compatibility issues

* Extends interactive question text in `integration:add` command, to clarify the meaning of options, their defaults, and their syntax
* Adds support for the "Enabled" (`is_enabled`) flag on environment variables.
* Adds `--no-expired` and `--only-expired` options to `certificate:list`
* Improves the "project not found" message, to suggest other project IDs
* Implements omitting non-required empty fields when adding an integration (allows earlier support for new integration options without breaking older projects)
* Adds the SSH_AGENT_PID to auto inherited environment variables (fixes using an SSH agent to manage keys when used with the CLI's Git commands)
* Adds an experimental `redis` command to connect to a Redis container (hidden from the command list for now)
* Adds experimental OS X Keychain support (enabled via `experimental.use_keychain`)

New features:
* Support remote projects/environments in app:list command.
* Add worker:list (workers) command.
* Use "deployments" HTTP API (instead of SSH) in app:config command.
* Auto-ensure webhooks on GitHub and GitLab integrations, where possible.

Other changes:
* Skip updates check if the Phar file is not writable.
* Remove different coloration for local commands in `list` (there are so few listed).
* Recommend --no-wait if snapshot:create is run in a non-TTY.
* Suggest project:set-remote in RootNotFoundException.
* Fix environment:drush (drush) command to use configured document root, or PLATFORM_DOCUMENT_ROOT where available.
* Be stricter about when to use $_ENV, when getting parent variables for PHP <7.1.

* Use browser login by default (the old login method is available as `auth:password-login`).
* Set `--build-pull-requests-post-merge` to false by default (GitHub integrations).
* Respect `--no-wait` in `environment:init`, and clear the environment cache afterwards.
* In the `project:delete` command, leave access control to the API.
* Support disabling or enabling colorized output via the CLICOLOR_FORCE environment variable.

* Improved `activity:log` output to show more activity information.
* Added `activity:get` command, hidden for now.
* Added `--date-fmt` option to `activity:list` and `snapshot:list`.
* Added detection for the date.timezone ini setting, and the TZ environment variable.
* Fixed inverted requirement of -e/-a options in activity:log (`-a` should make `-e` not required).
* Fixed user-defined aliases being prefixed with "@" (thanks to @GROwen, #677).
* Avoid fatal error if invalid YAML config is encountered during updateDrushAliases().
* Fixed SSH commands for very old OpenSSH versions <5.9 (using -t instead of RequestTTY).
* Updated dependencies (mainly Symfony 3.4.2 -> 3.4.4).

* [user:add] Improve `user:add` command to allow setting roles on all environments (aliased to `user:update`)
* [user:get] Add `user:get` command (aliased to and deprecating `user:role`)
* [db:dump] Remove --no-autocommit and simplify mysqldump args (#683)
* Expand redeploy warning to recommend `vset`
* [activity:get] Check for empty started_at when calculating duration
* [redis] Recommend "redis info" command

* Add `redeploy` command (available on projects with newer API versions).
* [activity:list] Format activity descriptions where possible.
* Print question text even when in automatic non-interactive mode.
* Add --wait option to all commands, and emit a warning if nothing is specified
  when running inside a Platform.sh build/cron/deploy hook.
* [integration:add] [integration:update] Ensure GitLab/GitHub hooks have the
  right events selected, and update them if not.
* [self:install] Ensure directory exists when creating shell-config.rc
* [activity:get] do not require an environment with --all and a partial ID
* [login] Mention --force option, if running when already logged in.

New features:

* Always interact (where possible) to ask for the project or environment, if one
  isn't specified or detected.
* Support new variable features:
  - Add `variable:create` and `variable:update` commands.
  - Allow creating 'sensitive' and 'non-inheritable' variables
    (`--sensitive=true` and `--inheritable=false`).
  - Add `variable:list` (`variables`) command.
  - These `variable:` commands now work with project- or environment-level
    variables. Specify the level with `--level` (`-l`). If you do not specify a
    level, you will be asked for one interactively where relevant.
  - The old commands still exist but are hidden from the command list.
* Add `project:clear-build-cache` command
* Enable `project:create` (`create`) command by default.
* Add `--all` option to `list` command, to show hidden commands.
* In `build` command, if --run-deploy-hooks option is used, run both "deploy"
  and "post_deploy" hooks.

Bug fixes:

* Fix: boolean false fields omitted when creating integrations.
* Fix wrapping of table cell contents that include decoration.

Other changes:

* Accept URLs (not just IDs) as project identifiers in `multi` command.
* Un-hide some commands
  - Un-hide `activity:get` command.
  - Un-hide `worker:list` (`workers`)
* Always use the deployment API for the app list (improves compatibility for
  multi-application Enterprise projects, in SSH-related commands).

New features:

* Add MongoDB commands: mongo, mongoexport, mongodump, and mongorestore.
* In the user:add command, add a wildcard (%) for the environment ID, so you can
  add users to multiple environments concisely via the --role option.
  See: platform help user:add
* Parse !include tags when loading a YAML file.

Other changes:

* In command help, word-wrap option descriptions to the terminal width.
* Try to refresh an environment before giving an "Operation not available" error.
* Fix `--pipe` option in the `user:role` command.
* Suppress PHP's timezone warning while detecting the system timezone.

* Increase the default interval between updates checks, from 1 day to 7 days.
* Fix formatting for activity descriptions that contain a `/` character.
* In the `project:set-remote` command, do not error out if the "current" project
  does not exist.
* Minor performance improvement to `user` commands when looking up existing
  users.

* Add `mount:size` command to find the disk usage of writable mounts.
* Add `--sensitive` option for project-level variables (affects commands:
  `variable:create`, `variable:update`, and `variable:list`).
* Clear environment/project caches after a 403 error.
* Increase prominence of warning in `db:size` command.
* Skip the automatic updates check if the Phar file is not writable.

New features:

* Add `service:list` (`services`) command.
* Add --depth option to `project:get` (`get`) command (allow shallow clones).
* Add --rebase option to the `environment:synchronize` (`sync`) command.
* Add --prune-branches option for GitHub and GitLab integrations.
* Add --worker option to the `environment:ssh` (`ssh`) command.

Other changes:

* When running pg_dump via the `db:dump` command, use the --no-owner flag.
* Fix the `--all` option in the `list` command.
* Prefer .bashrc over .bash_profile in the installer (self:install command).
* Remove legacy API workaround in `integration:update`.
* Update user commands for upstream API fix (improves performance).

New features:

* Add commit:list (commits) and commit:get commands for viewing commits via the
  API.
* Add --commit (-c) option to repo:cat and repo:ls commands.
* Add Bitbucket integration support.

Bug fixes:

* Fix drush alias group name prepending bug. Custom aliases were having the
  alias group name prepended every time they were recreated, e.g. "@foo.bar"
  would become "@foo.foo.bar".
* Allow changing the value of a project-level sensitive variable.

Other changes:

* Add explanations for "Operation not available" on environment actions.
* Add additional help for the mount:size command.
* Clean up --pipe output in the user:get command.
* Show hidden service commands.

* Fix a further source of 'Not logged in' errors immediately after login.
* Add `integration:validate` command, and improve error reporting in other
  integration commands.
* Deprecate the --type option in the `integration:update` command.
* Fix alpha UI URLs for environments in the `web` command.

New features:

* Add --columns option for all tables (to filter and order table columns).
* Add non-default "disk" and "size" columns to app:list command.
* Add non-default "updated_at" column to domains:list command.
* Add non-default "host" column to project:list command.
* Allow loading more than 10 snapshots via --limit in snapshot:list command.

Other changes:

* Change CSV/TSV table output to make it cleaner. CSV/TSV cells will now only
  be enclosed in quote marks if necessary, conforming to RFC 4180.
* Fail if password input cannot be hidden in auth:password-login command.
* Set the remote only for new branches in environment:branch command.
* Avoid wrapping dates in commit:list command.
* Update list of allowed SSH key algorithms for ssh-key:add command.
* Remove confirmation step in logout command.

* Revert csv/tsv table output to use LF instead of CRLF line breaks.
* Display project and environment title/ID in the following commands:
  `activity:list` (`activities`), `domain:list` (`domains`),
  `route:list` (`routes`), `snapshot:list` (`snapshots`),
  `user:list` (`users`), `worker:list` (`workers`) 
* Local build: handle `python3` dependencies type (same as `python`).
* Define the `path` column in the `mount:list` (`mounts`) command.
* Parse project URLs from the beta unified-UI.

* Allow restoring snapshots to another environment in snapshot:restore command
  (with new --target and --branch-from options).
* Sort interactive project/environment choices alphabetically.
* Fix "Name"/"name" column should always have been "Title"/"title" in
  environment:list command.
* Define "created" and "updated" columns in environment:list command.
* Remove interactivity check from installer.
* Fix: environments with an empty name (e.g. '0') not being recognized.
* Fix documentation in user:list, user:add and user:update commands.
* Various changes and new features in certificate:list command:
  - only show non-expired certificates by default
  - add --ignore-expiry option for the previous behavior
  - add --exclude-domain option to filter out certificates from the list
  - add --pipe-domains option to list domains covered by certificates
  - add "certs" alias
  - define "domains" column (for the --columns option)

New features:

* Add tunnel:single command (allow opening a tunnel without posix/pcntl).

Bug fixes:

* Fix bug where login to a new account does not log out from the old account.
* Account for differing app roots in Drush aliases - allows generated Drush
  aliases to work with Platform.sh Enterprise environments.
* Fix Drush 9 alias compatibility (and remove Drush 9-beta compatibility).

New features:

* Support multiple schemas per database relationship:
  - Add --schema option to `db:dump` and `db:sql` commands.
  - Include the service name and schema in the `db:dump` default filename.
  - Present a choice between schemas if no schema is specified.
  - Make `db:size` schema agnostic but warn about inaccessible schemas.

Bug fixes:

* Use a different Drush alias root for site-local versions 8 or 9. Drush 9
  fails to find a Drupal root via a relative path in some circumstances.
* Fix behavior of choice questions with no default in non-interactive mode.
* Fix checkout command when there is only one branch.
* Fix Drush lock files not being used in local:build command.

Other changes:

* Add some 3-letter command aliases:
  - activity:list => activities => act
  - environment:list => environments => env
  - project:list => projects => pro
  - variable:list => variables => var

New features:

* Better worker support:
  - Improve worker selection in the environment:ssh (ssh) command.
  - Add the --worker option to all mount commands.
  - Add the --worker option to the environment:logs (log) command.
  - If --app or --worker is not provided, the above commands will now prompt you
  to choose between the app(s) or their worker(s).
* Allow a nonexistent --target directory in the mount:download command (prompt
  to create it).

Bug fixes:

* Add environment commit SHA to the deployment cache key
  This ensures old deployment information is not used when we know the environment
  has changed.
* Ensure migrated projects on a new host do not use cached information from the
  old host.
* Installer: the default config file should be .bash_profile on OS X.

Other changes:

* Update autocompletion library (stecman/symfony-console-completion)
  Highlights:
  - "Adds support for quoted and escaped multi-word completions"
  - "Fixes options appearing before the command name (eg. `program -v cmdname`)
    breaking the detection of the command that should be completed for"

* Support older shells in autocompletion setup (like Bash 3.x, installed by default on OS X).
* Accept wholly indented YAML files under the !include syntax.
* Pass max_allowed_packet setting to mysqldump.
* Require confirmation when adding a git source integration (GitHub, Bitbucket or GitLab).
* Improve GIT_SSH argument quoting (may improve old Git version compatibility).
* Fix ssh for environments with broken config.
* Support installing versions with unstable suffixes in installer.
* Warn in installer about missing pcntl and posix extensions.
* Display nothing rather than a placeholder for sensitive values in variable:list tsv/csv format.
* Add beta (hidden for now) source-operation:run command.

* Allow some commands to read from local environment variables when available:
    * `route:list` (routes) and `route:get` can read from PLATFORM_ROUTES
    * `relationship:list` (relationships) can read from PLATFORM_RELATIONSHIPS
    * New `decode` command, to decode a base64- and JSON-encoded string such as
      PLATFORM_VARIABLES, PLATFORM_APPLICATION, etc.
* Add --id and --primary options to route:get command, to select a route.
* Add `url` property to all relationships in `relationships` command (e.g. to
  extract a DSN for a database).
* Multiple changes to the `db:size` command (by @matthiaz):
    * Improve accuracy of size estimates by altering psql commands and querying
      for InnoDB-specific information.
    * Add --bytes (-B) option to display sizes in bytes.
    * Check if InnoDB tables can be optimized, and run optimizations
      automatically with the `--cleanup` option.

New features:

* Allow the `app:config` command to read from PLATFORM_APPLICATION in the
  local environment.
* Improvements to the `environment:url` (`url`) command:
    * Read URLs from PLATFORM_ROUTES in the local environment.
    * Always prefer the primary route URL when sorting URLs.
    * Add a --primary option, to print or open only the primary route URL.
    * Just print URLs (without interaction) when there is no display/browser
      available.

Other changes:

* Prefer the primary route as the site URL (for Drush aliases, etc.).
* Use embedded user account information if available in the access API (small
  performance improvement).
* Fix "Failed to decode" in the `relationships` command when there are no
  relationships.
* Adapt `welcome` command for offline-on-container uses. If you install the CLI
  into your own Platform.sh project, running `platform` on its own now gives
  you a list of useful commands that work "offline" without needing to
  configure an API token.
* Do not require login for the `self:stats` command.
* Improve app/worker choice message.
* Clearer error for no config (`.platform.app.yaml`) file.
* Match user email addresses case-insensitively. This fixes all user commands
  that need an email address (user:add, user:get, user:update and user:delete).

New features:

* Add --all (-a) option to mount:download command. This lets you download files
  from all of an application's mounts.
* Enable gzip encoding in all API requests, if the zlib PHP extension is
  available. This should result in a performance improvement, particularly for
  slow connections or API responses containing a lot of data (e.g. the
  activity:list or environment:list commands).

Other changes:

* In mount:upload, convert OS X filename characters using rsync's `--iconv`.
* Small bug fix for commit and repo commands: do not fetch an empty commit
  hash (after stripping commit parents notation).
* Installer: fix check for git on Windows.

New features:

* Add --charset option to the db:dump command.
  Specifying the character set is recommended for any database dump.
  If your application database is in MySQL's utf8mb4, for example, use:
      platform db:dump --charset utf8mb4
* Add --branch option to the 'push' command.
  This allows a new environment to be created as an active branch from a
  specified parent - thus inheriting settings from that parent - rather than
  setting the parent later.
* Add bitbucket_server integration support.

Other changes:

* Installer:
  - Add --shell-type option to specify 'bash' or 'zsh' to the installer, for
    example:
        curl -sfS https://platform.sh/cli/installer | php -- --shell-type bash
  - Add --manifest option to use a test or development manifest file.
  - Require the curl, openssl and pcre PHP extensions (and stop requiring
    mbstring).
  - The --dev option will now allow any version string.
* Rename "Capacity" to "% Used" in mount:size command.
  Also makes column machine names consistent with the db:size command.

* Allow service commands to work 'locally' on the container
  
    It's now possible to use the following commands on the Platform.sh container
    without needing to have an API token or log in to the API:

    * db:dump
    * db:sql (sql)
    * service:redis-cli (redis)
    * service:mongo:dump (mongodump)
    * service:mongo:export (mongoexport)
    * service:mongo:restore (mongorestore)
    * service:mongo:shell (mongo)
  
    N.B.: When running locally the db:dump and db:sql commands have less schema
    information, so you may need to specify the --schema option.
    
    Commands that could already run on the container are:

    * help, list
    * app:config
    * decode
    * environment:url (url)
    * relationship:list (relationships)
    * route:get
    * route:list (routes)

* Alias --primary to -1 in route:get and environment:url (url) commands.
  
* Use primary route URL from deployments API in Drush aliases, when possible.
  
* Allow multiple command arguments in drush and ssh commands.

* Rename 'snapshot' commands to 'backup', to match the API and Management Console.
* Implement streaming activity logs.
  - Add --timestamps (-t) option to the activity:log command.
  - Report the real start time in the activity progress bar.
* Significantly reduce default cache lifetimes (due to API performance improvements).

New features:

* Allow the mount:list and mount:size commands to run locally on the container.

Other changes:

* Allow the SHA hash to wrap in the commit:list (commits) table.
* Improve help for old, deprecated variable commands.
* Refine description of --yes and --no options.
* Deprecate 3 unused options in the commit:get command.
* Fix --schema help in the db:sql command.
* Make activity success/failure messages consistent.
* Fix URL formatting in tunnel:single command output.
* Fix property not found error in decode command with an empty object.
* Display simple table (no messages) in integration:list if the --format is tsv or csv.
* Changes to the environment:push (push) command:
  - Improve deprecation message for the --branch option.
  - Fix swapped question text for new/existing environments.
  - Wait for remaining activities.
* Changes relating to waiting for multiple activities:
  - Fix activities being lost when reporting status after waiting.
  - Switch to the activity log stream for failed activities after waiting.
  - Increase timeout for initially fetching the log stream.

New features:

* Add an environment:scp (scp) command to transfer individual files.
* Provide project choice in 'project:set-remote' command.
* Add api:curl command to use the API directly.
* Suggest to set the project as the remote, when 'get' command is used in an
  existing repository.
* Add --set-remote and --no-set-remote options to project:create (create)
  command, which set the new project as the remote if called from an existing
  repository.
* Provide interactive choice in variable:get (vget) command.
* Add 'Enabled' (is_enabled) column in variable:list (var) command.
* Add 'Machine name' (machine_name) column (not default) in environment:list
  (env) command.

Bug fixes:

* Revert change that made Drush alias paths relative: they are now absolute
  again, as the relative paths did not work with the Drush sql-sync or rsync
  commands (#873).
* Update API client to standardize project git URLs.
* Do not require Git to find a git root.
* Fix 'get' command detecting a project conflict in a separate directory.
* Do not URL-encode the repository in Bitbucket API requests.
* Add Docker setup for local development.
* Refresh environments in the welcome command ('platform' on its own).

New features:

* Add PLATFORMSH_CLI_NO_INTERACTION environment variable, which can be used to
  disable interactivity everywhere (warning: important confirmation questions
  would be bypassed).
* Add health.webhook integration type.

Other changes:

* Fix: avoid listing duplicate activities and avoid an infinite loop in
  activity:list (activities) command.
* Remove handling of activity "log" property.
* Fix init command example GitHub URL.
* Update the project git URL when adding/deleting an integration.

New features:

* Add an `environment:xdebug` (`xdebug`) command, which opens an SSH tunnel to
  help debug PHP applications. The application must be configured with an
  xdebug trigger key (help is available by running the command).

Improvements to Windows installation

* Generate a `platform.bat` file during installation (the `self:install`
  command) so `platform` can be found in the Path.
* Use \ as the directory separator in user-facing installation paths.
* Fix browser login: two bugs that prevented starting the local server, and
  preventing opening the URL in the browser.
* Improve installation help messages for setting up the Path environment
  variable when using the Command Prompt.

New features:

  * Use Docker credential helpers to store secrets.
    There are 3 Docker credential helpers available from:
    https://github.com/docker/docker-credential-helpers

    These allow storing secrets in a system appropriate way: Keychain on OS X,
    the libsecret keyring on Linux (the GNOME keyring), and the Credential
    Manager on Windows.

    This falls back to the previous file-based storage for systems incompatible with
    the credential helpers.

  * Add integration:activity commands:
    - integration:activity:get
    - integration:activity:list (i:act)
    - integration:activity:log

  * Add API token login command (auth:api-token-login).

  * Supply SSH options to mount:upload and mount:download commands.
    This allows specifying an SSH key with the --identity-file (-i) option to
    these commands.

Other changes:

  * Remove password login help (the auth:password-login command is deprecated).
  * xdebug: change "key" to "idekey".
  * Prefer .zshrc rather than .zprofile for installation in ZSH.
  * Show the command output for failed processes to help debugging.

New features:

* Automatically prompt for login when token refresh fails.

Other changes:

* Fix deleting httpaccess settings via the environment:httpaccess command.
* Remove the unused --environment option for integration:activity commands
  This also stops the commands unnecessarily prompting for an environment.
* Tweak help for browser login.
* Remove default From address for health.email notifications
  The API now provides a sensible default.

New features:

* Add activity scripts (`script`) integration type

Other changes:

* Suppress "Link not found: #manage-access" exception in backup:create command.
* Clarify deprecation message for the --type option on the integration:update command.
* Make integration:update command determine changes correctly.

New features:

* Support an option for building draft pull requests in the GitHub integration,
  and the equivalent (building WIP merge requests) for GitLab.
* Add automatic SSH certificate support (disabled by default).

Other changes:

* Add `environment:deactivate` as an alias of the `environment:delete` command.
* Fix error in command listing, when the .platform.app.yaml is not found

New features:

* Improve SSH key commands
  - Provide a choice and a more meaningful key name when generating a key in the
    `ssh-key:add` command.
  - Clarify the account that an SSH key is going to be added to.
  - Append the `.pub` extension automatically.
  - Show the local path (if present) in the `ssh-key:list` (`ssh-keys`) command.
  - Ensure session-based SSH configuration is up to date, when running any SSH command.
* Automatically select an SSH key from `~/.ssh` corresponding to the user
  account when there are multiple identities available, and specify it in SSH
  commands.
* Provide an interactive choice in the `integration:update` command when no
  integration ID is specified.
* Add a `session:switch` command (beta), which helps change the session when
  managing multiple accounts. When there is more than one session present,
  information (session ID and logged-in user email) is displayed in various
  relevant commands.

Other changes:

* Fix irrelevant 403 errors when the user does not have access to the current
  project, but they specified another project in the command line anyway.
* Include only one session's SSH certificate configuration.
* Fix use of certifier URL configuration.
* Remove the command `auth:password-login`, which no longer works.

* Support prompting for re-authentication in the login command.
  The command `platform login --force` (or `-f`) will now ask the
  authentication server to prompt the user to log in again, even if they
  already had a session in that browser. This is helpful for refreshing
  authentication status (e.g. to re-verify 2FA), or for logging in as another
  account.
* The region list in the `platform create` command is now sorted
  alphabetically (with the subdomain and suffix sorted separately).
* Add `--count` (`-c`) option to the `self:stats` command to modify the results per page.
* Move the SSH hostname to the session-specific SSH configuration. This means
  less rewriting needed for the global `~/.ssh/config` file when changing CLI
  configuration.

* Support new user invitations
* Installer improvements:
  - Create a .zshrc file if it doesn't already exist, on ZSH.
  - Require the mbstring extension.

New features:

* Autoload SSH certificates on login or SSH, by default.
    When supported by all relevant servers (soon), SSH certificates will:
    - Enable support for multi-factor authentication on projects that require it for SSH access.
    - Make it no longer necessary to add or administer SSH keys manually.

  Note: SSH certificates can be checked or reloaded using the `ssh-cert:load` command.

Other changes:

* SSH configuration improvements:
  - Denote top-level SSH configuration with a `Host` block, to avoid issues where a previous `Host` or `Match` configuration had not been closed.
  - End the Host blocks explicitly with `Host *`
* Fix detection of third-party Git domains for `project:get` (`get`) command errors.

New features:

* Project choice will now be via an autocomplete, rather than a list, if there
  are too many to list (more than 25, or more than the terminal height). Start
  typing a project ID, or use the up and down arrows to scroll through the
  autocomplete suggestions.
* Similarly, the environment choice can now be via a list, if there are few
  enough to display like that, otherwise the older autocomplete will show.
* The installer now supports a proxy defined with one of the `https_proxy` or
  `http_proxy` environment variables.

Other changes:

* Use --globoff by default in curl commands
* Disable use of the SSH agent unless explicitly enabled in the user config file.
  Add this to the user config file to automatically add keys/certificates to the SSH agent:
  ```yaml
  # ~/.platformsh/config.yaml
  api:
    add_to_ssh_agent: true
  ```
* Explicitly request the `offline_access` scope when logging in.
* Add a comment to auto-generated temporary SSH keys.

* Support force-sending an invitation in the `user:add` command (via a prompt,
  or the `--force-invite` option).
* Retry fetching the activity log stream to avoid errors when an activity is starting.
* Show the stderr of every shell command, if in debug mode (`-vvv`).
* Handle multi-host mongodb URIs in relationships.
